place.name: LANGFORD
place.gazetteerText: LANGFORD, a parish in Swaffham district, Norfolk; on the river Wissey, 3 miles NE of Mundford and 7¼ NE by N of Brandon r. station. Post-town, Mundford, under Brandon. Acres, 1,405. Real property, £748. Pop., 62. Houses, 11. The manor belongs to Lord Ashburton. The living is a rectory, united with the rectory of Igborough, in the diocese of Norwich. Value, £248.* Patron, Lord Ashburton. The church is early English, and contains a monument to Sir Jacob Garrard. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
